title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 151.3 - New York State personal income tax returns by or for minors
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 151.3 - New York State personal income tax returns by or for minors

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 651

For income tax purposes, a minor is a taxpayer and is
subject to the same requirements for making New York State returns of income as
are other individuals, even though the minor's parent has, under local law, the
legal right to the minor's earnings from personal services and actually
receives such earnings. If the minor is unable to make his New York State
personal income tax return, his parent, guardian or other person charged with
the care of his person or property must make and file such return for him; see
section
151.12
of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
151.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
